header: The Fiercest Fighting of the Ukraine War May Be in Russia
desc: The Times interviewed Russian soldiers who said they face a brutal fight to dislodge determined Ukrainian forces from a sliver of Russian land. Trapped civilians fear catastrophe.
author: By Nanna Heitmann, Anatoly Kurmanaev and Ekaterina Bodyagina

header: Ukrainian Lawmakers Approve Contentious Purchase of Nuclear Reactors
desc: Opponents of the project say it is costly, will take far too long to strengthen Ukraine’s battered power supply and opens the door to corruption.
author: By Constant Méheut

header: Can European ‘Boots on the Ground’ Help Protect Ukraine’s Security?
desc: Deterring Russia from re-invading Ukraine, once this war ends, could require 150,000 troops and American help with air cover, intelligence and missile defense, experts say.
author: By Steven Erlanger

header: How Ukraine Pitched Trump on a Deal for Critical Minerals
desc: President Trump says he wants to make a deal for minerals from Ukraine in exchange for aid. That followed a long effort by Ukrainian officials to appeal to Mr. Trump’s transactional nature.
author: By Constant Méheut

header: Hegseth Says Return to Ukraine’s Pre-2014 Borders Is ‘Unrealistic’
desc: In his first trip abroad, the new U.S. defense secretary told allies, including NATO officials, that a durable peace could only come “with a realistic assessment of the battlefield.”
author: By Steven Erlanger

header: Treasury Secretary Makes Trip to Kyiv
desc: The visit by Scott Bessent was the first by a Trump official since the president’s return to office and came amid uncertainty about the future of U.S. support for Ukraine.
author: By Maria Varenikova

header: North Korea Is Caring for Russia’s Wounded Soldiers, Envoy Says
desc: Russia’s ambassador to North Korea said that its Asian ally is also hosting Russian children orphaned by its war against Ukraine, as the two nations deepen ties.
author: By Choe Sang-Hun

header: Who Is Marc Fogel? The American Teacher Caught in a Global Power Struggle.
desc: Mr. Fogel, who had lived and taught in many countries, including Russia for nine years, spent 3 1 years in Russian custody for having cannabis for medical use, and is in poor health.
author: By Ivan Nechepurenko and Julian E. Barnes

header: U.S. Is Releasing Russian Cybercriminal to Moscow, Officials Say
desc: The release is part of a swap with the Kremlin that freed an American schoolteacher being held in a Russian prison.
author: By Anton Troianovski, Maggie Haberman, Julian E. Barnes and Jonathan Swan

header: What International Law Says About Trump’s Proposal to Remove Palestinians From Gaza
desc: Taking over the enclave, forcing Palestinians to leave and preventing them from returning would be clear violations of international law, experts say.
author: By Amanda Taub

header: Ukraine Will Not Be Sidelined in Peace Talks With Russia, Trump Says
desc: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine and European defense ministers had expressed concern that they might not be present for talks between President Trump and Russia’s leader to end the war.
author: By Jeanna Smialek, Zolan Kanno-Youngs, Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Thomas Fuller

header: To some Ukrainian soldiers, the prospect of cease-fire talks is ‘too painful.’
desc: NA
author: By Constant Méheut

header: Ukraine’s Borders in Maps: Pre-2014 Invasion to Now
desc: Ukraine’s government wants to restore the country’s frontier to where it was before Russia launched its first invasion more than a decade ago. The U.S. defense secretary said that was “unrealistic.”
author: By Matthew Mpoke Bigg

header: Cease-fire talks could upend Ukraine’s domestic politics.
desc: NA
author: By Andrew E. Kramer

header: Can Britain avoid a rift with Trump over Ukraine?
desc: Prime Minister Keir Starmer faces a diplomatic dilemma as he weighs his longstanding support for Ukraine against his determination to cultivate President Trump.
author: By Mark Landler

header: Ukrainians Fear Peace May Strand Them Forever From Lost Homes
desc: Bitterness has greeted suggestions that occupied territory will have to be ceded to Russia: “It’s like ripping off a man’s arm or leg and then saying, ‘Let it be as it is.’”
author: By Kim Barker

header: Russian Drone Damages Radiation Shield at Chernobyl, Ukraine Says
desc: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine called the damage “significant” but said there were no signs of radiation leaks. A Kremlin spokesman denied that Russia had carried out the strike.
author: By Kim Barker, Andrew E. Kramer and Qasim Nauman

header: NATO Emphasizes Unity as Concerns Mount That Europe Will Be Left Out of Ukraine Talks
desc: President Trump has made it clear that he is pushing for an end to the war in Ukraine. The move has left Europe worried that it, and Ukraine, could be left out as he negotiates with Russia’s leader, Vladimir V. Putin.
author: By Jeanna Smialek and John Ismay

header: Trump Says Saudi Arabia May Host Talks With Vladimir Putin on Ukraine
desc: The kingdom has increasingly emerged as a mediator in the Russia-Ukraine war, leveraging ties with both sides as well as with President Trump.
author: By Ismaeel Naar

header: Warming Trend in U.S.-Russia Relations Leaves Ukraine in a Tough Spot
desc: Trump’s recent moves, including a conversation with Putin and a demand for Ukrainian mineral rights, are worrisome signs for Zelensky.
author: By Andrew E. Kramer

header: Ukraine Rejects U.S. Demand for Half of Its Mineral Resources
desc: President Volodymyr Zelensky publicly faulted the American proposal because it did not include security guarantees.
author: By Constant Méheut, Andrew E. Kramer, David E. Sanger and Eve Sampson

header: Left Out of Ukraine Talks, Europe Races to Organize a Response
desc: The Trump administration’s push for direct negotiations with Russia without Ukraine’s involvement leaves the European allies with no clear role.
author: By Andrew E. Kramer

header: Starmer Offers to Send U.K. Peacekeeping Troops to Ukraine
desc: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said for the first time on Sunday that he was “ready and willing” to deploy troops to help guarantee Ukraine’s security.
author: By Yan Zhuang

header: German Chancellor Rebukes Vance for Supporting Party That Downplays Nazis
desc: At the Munich Security Conference, Olaf Scholz accused the U.S. vice president of unacceptable interference in Germany’s coming elections.
author: By Jim Tankersley and Andrew E. Kramer

header: Former Charity Worker and Activist Faces an Unlikely Accusation: Coup Plotter
desc: A woman who runs a pro-Ukraine group has been accused by Prime Minister Robert Fico of Slovakia of plotting to topple him as part of his campaign against organizations he says are funded from abroad.
author: By Andrew Higgins

header: Putin Has Long Wanted More Power in Europe. Trump Could Grant It.
desc: Remarks by Vice President JD Vance and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth are fueling concerns that the U.S. will move away from Europe and align with Moscow.
author: By Paul Sonne

header: Trump’s Ambition to Redraw the World Map Ignores Those Affected Most
desc: President Trump’s approach to foreign policy deals is reviving a bygone imperial approach that may backfire, experts say.
author: By Mark Landler

header: A Quick, Quiet Trip to Belarus Signals a Turn in U.S. Policy
desc: After years of the U.S. trying to isolate Russia’s closest ally, a meeting with Belarus’s president points to better relations, raising hopes of loosening his repression and his embrace of Moscow.
author: By Andrew Higgins and Tomas Dapkus

header: Even in Death, Navalny Is Seen by the Kremlin as an Enduring Threat
desc: Russian authorities have zealously prosecuted people with links to Aleksei A. Navalny’s organization inside Russia in the year since he died.
author: By Paul Sonne and Nataliya Vasilyeva

header: German Election Spotlight Turns to Trump
desc: The American president’s foreign policy, and a divisive speech by his vice president, drew attention away from an attack by a refugee that some expected would fan political tensions over migration.
author: By Jim Tankersley

header: European Leaders Meet in Paris as U.S. Pushes Ahead With Ukraine Plan
desc: The hastily called gathering was part of a flurry of diplomacy expected to center on Ukraine this week as Trump officials prepare to start talks with Russia on their own.
author: By Catherine Porter and Steven Erlanger

header: U.S. and Russia Pursue Partnership in a Head-Spinning Shift in Relations
desc: The two sides met in Saudi Arabia for their most extensive discussions in years. In addition to Ukraine, business ties were on the table.
author: By Anton Troianovski and Ismaeel Naar

header: How Can It End? A Step-by-Step Guide to a Possible Ukraine Deal.
desc: Balancing Ukraine’s sovereignty with Russia’s demand for its own “security guarantees” promises to be the hardest part of any negotiation. But experts see possible compromises.
author: By Anton Troianovski

header: After Walking a Fine Line With Trump, Zelensky Shows His Annoyance
desc: Left out of a meeting between American and Saudi officials, the Ukrainian leader also canceled a trip to Riyadh.
author: By Andrew E. Kramer

header: Rubio Meets Saudi Crown Prince for Talks on Gaza and Ukraine
desc: Marco Rubio’s visit to Riyadh, his first as secretary of state, came amid uncertainty about the future of Gaza and Ukraine and criticism of unilateral U.S. moves over the wars in both places.
author: By Patrick Kingsley and Ismaeel Naar

header: Europe’s Leaders, Dazed by an Ally Acting Like an Adversary, Recalculate
desc: Faced with undisguised hostility from the Trump administration, Europeans are preparing for what is shaping up to be a go-it-alone era.
author: By Mark Landler

header: The Land Ukraine Could Be Forced to Give Up to End the War
desc: President Trump has promised to bring a quick end to the war in Ukraine, suggesting that Russia could keep at least some of the Ukrainian territory it had captured.
author: By Andrew E. Kramer, Nikolay Nikolov, Laura Salaberry and Samuel Granados

header: U.S. and Russian Officials Agree to Work on Ukraine War Settlement
desc: After more than four hours of discussions in Saudi Arabia, both sides also agreed to work on normalizing bilateral relations and investments.
author: By The New York Times

header: Zelensky and Trump Trade Blows as Feud Escalates Over Peace Talks
desc: President Trump called Volodymyr Zelensky a “dictator without elections” after the Ukrainian president said Mr. Trump was in a “web of disinformation.”
author: By Andrew E. Kramer, Constant Méheut and Anton Troianovski

header: Ukrainians, Stunned by Trump’s Comments, Fear They Can No Longer Trust U.S.
desc: President Trump’s claim that Ukraine was responsible for its war with Russia has left many Ukrainians disillusioned.
author: By Maria Varenikova

header: Trump Falsely Says Ukraine Started the War With Russia. Here Is What to Know.
desc: A look at how the war in Ukraine began, the state of the peace talks and why the country isn’t holding elections.
author: By Matthew Mpoke Bigg

header: Zelensky Meets U.S. Envoy to Ukraine Amid Public Feud With Trump
desc: Keith Kellogg and President Volodymyr Zelensky were expected to discuss possible paths to ending the war and ways to defuse tensions between Washington and Kyiv.
author: By Constant Méheut

header: Bucha Has a Question: Does Trump Remember the Russian Massacre?
desc: Residents of a Ukrainian suburb that was the site of notorious attacks on civilians after Russia invaded are alarmed by President Trump’s warm words for Moscow.
author: By Kim Barker

header: U.S. Objects to Calling Russia ‘Aggressor’ in G7 Statement on Invasion
desc: The American opposition to a draft of a Group of 7 statement marking the third anniversary of Russia’s attack on Ukraine comes after President Trump blamed Kyiv for starting the war.
author: By Steven Erlanger, Matina Stevis-Gridneff and David E. Sanger

header: As Moscow and Washington Talk, Russians Hope the Result Is Normalcy
desc: Many people in Russia expressed relief that an end to the conflict in Ukraine seemed nearer and that the hardships of war, and the shunning of their country by much of the world, may soon end.
author: By Ivan Nechepurenko, Nataliya Vasilyeva and Alina Lobzina

header: With Explosive Goggles, Ukraine Sought to Blast Russian Drone Operators
desc: A senior Ukrainian intelligence official confirmed the plot to blow up drone goggles. But it was unclear how much effect the scheme had on Russian forces.
author: By Kim Barker and Michael Schwirtz

header: Meeting Again in Paris, European Leaders Try to Recalibrate After Trump Sides With Russia
desc: The American president’s latest remarks embracing Vladimir Putin’s narrative that Ukraine is to blame for the war have compounded the sense of alarm among traditional allies.
author: By Catherine Porter and Andrew Higgins

header: Kremlin Message to Trump: There’s Money to Be Made in Russia
desc: Russian officials are arguing that American companies stand to make billions of dollars by re-entering Russia. The White House is listening.
author: By Anton Troianovski

header: Russia Talks Peace While Troops Threaten New Region in Ukraine
desc: Moscow’s forces are three miles from Dnipropetrovsk, a province they have never invaded. If they cross in, the advance would be a morale blow to Ukraine and complicate any territorial negotiations.
author: By Constant Méheut, Olha Konovalova and Tyler Hicks

header: U.S. Pressing Tough Demands in Revised Deal for Ukraine’s Minerals
desc: The Trump administration wants revenues from Ukraine’s natural resources, according to a draft obtained by The New York Times, with no security guarantee in exchange.
author: By Constant Méheut and Andrew E. Kramer

header: U.S. and Ukraine Appear to Move Closer to Deal for Minerals Amid Leaders’ Public Feud
desc: President Trump on Friday continued to bash President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine and pressure him for mineral rights.
author: By Andrew E. Kramer and Luke Broadwater

header: Emboldened Kremlin Steps Up Efforts to Seize Businesses in Russia
desc: The legal onslaught on Moscow’s second-largest airport has been seen as part of the Kremlin’s wartime drive to seize control of key assets still in private hands.
author: By Nataliya Vasilyeva

header: Shocked by Trump, Europe Turns Its Hopes to Germany’s Election
desc: Germany’s economy is stalled and its politics fractured. But it sees an opening for a new chancellor to lead Europe’s response to a changing America.
author: By Jim Tankersley and Christopher F. Schuetze

header: Germany’s Economy Was Once the Envy of Europe. Not Anymore
desc: Metrics reveal an economy sliding backward. It will be one of the biggest issues in the election set for Sunday.
author: By Jim Tankersley and Josh Holder

header: On the Ropes, Olaf Scholz Keeps Punching
desc: The German chancellor, who defied calls to step aside after his government fell apart, is down in the polls but insisting he can still win.
author: By Christopher F. Schuetze

header: Europe Vows to Step Up Baltic Sea Security After a New Cable Break
desc: The bloc announced new steps to prevent threats to undersea lines after Sweden discovered damage to one east of Gotland island.
author: By Isabella Kwai, Christina Anderson and Johanna Lemola

header: Arab Leaders Scramble to Counter Trump’s Gaza Plans
desc: Leaders of Gulf states met with their Egyptian and Jordanian counterparts to strategize before a broader Arab summit early next month.
author: By Ismaeel Naar

header: When Germany Votes, It Will Be About the Economy
desc: The country’s competitiveness has stagnated and its once-powerful industries are suffering. Just ask these executives.
author: By Melissa Eddy and Jim Tankersley

header: Three Years Into War in Ukraine, Trump Ushers In New World for Putin
desc: Fresh possibilities have emerged for President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia with a change of power in Washington.
author: By Paul Sonne

header: Europe Prepares to Face Russia as Trump’s America Steps Back
desc: European leaders visited Kyiv to mark the war’s third anniversary. The show of solidarity in Ukraine on Monday comes at a head-spinning moment for the continent.
author: By Kim Barker, Jeanna Smialek and Steven Erlanger

header: Zelensky Pushes Back Against U.S. Mineral Deal and Announces European Summit
desc: The Ukrainian leader also said he would step down if Ukraine was allowed to join NATO, though it was unclear if he was serious or not.
author: By Constant Méheut and Andrew E. Kramer

header: Russian Officials Mark Ukraine War Anniversary With Resounding Silence
desc: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia is not scheduled to attend any events on Monday to mark the anniversary of the full-scale invasion that he ordered.
author: By Nataliya Vasilyeva

header: Zelensky Sets Somber Tone as Ukraine Marks War Anniversary
desc: For Ukrainians, Feb. 24 was a day to remember, without major ceremony, what has been lost in the three years since Russia’s full-scale invasion.
author: By Maria Varenikova

header: Ukraine Nears a Deal to Give U.S. a Share of Its Mineral Wealth
desc: President Trump said that Ukraine’s president may soon visit the White House to sign a deal, though how it ties in to efforts to end the Russian invasion and guarantee Ukraine’s security is unclear.
author: By Constant Méheut

header: Fair or Not, Zelensky Is Angering Trump. Is His Style Hurting Ukraine?
desc: Through three years of wartime leadership, Ukraine’s president has mostly played weak hands wisely. But his approach has fallen flat with the Trump administration.
author: By Andrew E. Kramer

header: U.S. and European Allies Split Sharply at the U.N. Over Ukraine
desc: The United States opposed a resolution demanding Russian withdrawal from Ukraine, but won Security Council approval of one calling for peace without assigning blame, exposing fissures between allies.
author: By Farnaz Fassihi

header: In One Woman’s Life, the Story of Ukraine’s War, 3 Years On
desc: In treatment for cancer and with her husband in a Russian prison, Olha Kurtmallaieva, 25, worries that time may be running out for her and, possibly, her country.
author: By Kim Barker

header: Putin Dangles Rare Earths Deals for U.S. in Russia and Occupied Ukraine
desc: In an interview broadcast on Monday, President Vladimir Putin said U.S. companies stood to profit in Russia, but suggested a Ukraine peace deal was still far off.
author: By Anton Troianovski

header: U.S. and Ukraine Agree to Minerals Deal, Officials Say
desc: President Trump, who had insisted he wanted “payback” for past military aid to Kyiv, suggested President Volodymyr Zelensky would visit Washington this week to sign an agreement, which he called a “very big deal.”
author: By Constant Méheut, Andrew E. Kramer and Alan Rappeport

header: The U.S.-Ukraine Mineral Deal: What We Know
desc: After a heated meeting in the White House, both sides have signaled that they are still open to reaching an agreement.
author: By Andrew E. Kramer, Maria Varenikova and Constant Méheut

header: Facing Trump’s Hostility, Ukraine Weighs Its Options. But They Are Few.
desc: There is a broad reckoning in Ukraine: Washington can no longer be relied upon as a supporter. But Kyiv still has agency on the battlefield and can seek increased support from Europe.
author: By Constant Méheut

header: Taiwan Watches Trump Undercut Ukraine, Hoping It Won’t Be Next
desc: As President Trump turns toward Russia, Taiwan grapples with its reliance on U.S. support in the face of conflict with China.
author: By Chris Buckley and Amy Chang Chien

header: Draft of Minerals Deal Features Vague Reference to Ukrainian Security
desc: A copy of the agreement obtained by The New York Times says that the United States “supports Ukraine’s effort to obtain security guarantees needed to establish lasting peace.”
author: By Andrew E. Kramer and Constant Méheut

header: At Stake in Ukraine-Trump Deal: Titanium, Lithium and Rare Earths
desc: The country has a bounty of minerals and other natural resources, including gas and oil, but they may not be easy to extract.
author: By Maria Varenikova and Andrew E. Kramer

header: Trump’s Ukraine Mineral Deal Is Seen as ‘Protection Racket’ Diplomacy
desc: The United States wants to be paid in exchange for helping the country fend off an invader.
author: By Amanda Taub

header: Rare Protest at U.S. Embassy in Ukraine Reflects Fears Over Trump
desc: The demonstration drew only a handful of people, but showed how some Ukrainians fear that Washington is drifting away from backing Ukraine now that President Trump is in power.
author: By Kim Barker

header: How Can Europe Talk to Trump? Flatter, Then Gently Resist.
desc: Emmanuel Macron, the French president, epitomized how the continent’s leaders are trying to navigate President Trump’s increasingly hostile administration.
author: By Jeanna Smialek and Aurelien Breeden

header: Starmer Flies to Meet Trump, With a Gift and a Difficult Message
desc: Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain cut international aid to raise military spending. He’s hoping to make a case for Ukraine at the White House.
author: By Mark Landler

header: Long Shunned, Pro-Russia Politicians in Ukraine See an Opening
desc: From prison and from exile, supporters of Moscow have been ramping up social media posts aimed at backing Russia’s call for elections in Ukraine and slamming President Volodymyr Zelensky.
author: By Maria Varenikova

header: Ukrainians Blindsided by Deal’s Breakdown and by Trump’s Actions
desc: Some said they felt the U.S. president was disrespectful and that they were proud of their leader for standing up to him.
author: By Kim Barker and Oleksandra Mykolyshyn

header: Zelensky, Seeking a Diplomatic Victory With Trump, Leaves With a Debacle
desc: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine had hoped to secure U.S. support in any cease-fire talks with Russia. Instead, his curdled relationship with President Trump was revealed in the Oval Office.
author: By Andrew E. Kramer

header: Zelensky seeks a place at cease-fire talks, and U.S. security guarantees.
desc: NA
author: By Andrew E. Kramer

header: Putin Praises Trump for Working to Thaw U.S.-Russia Tensions
desc: “The first contacts with the new American administration give us some hope,” the Russian president said in televised comments on Thursday.
author: By Nataliya Vasilyeva

header: North Korea Is Sending More Troops to Russia, South Korea Says
desc: The fresh deployment comes after North Korea suffered heavy casualties on the front lines in Russia’s war against Ukraine, the South’s spy agency says.
author: By Choe Sang-Hun

header: With a Letter From King Charles, Starmer Was Welcomed Into Trump’s Court
desc: The British prime minister, Keir Starmer, presented President Trump with a royal invitation and scored several political wins. But his top goal — a security guarantee for Ukraine — remained elusive.
author: By Mark Landler

header: Indifference or Hostility? Trump’s View of European Allies Raises Alarm
desc: Debate is building over just how deep the Trump administration’s antagonism runs, and whether the real goal is to destroy the European Union.
author: By Steven Erlanger

header: China’s Military Puts Pacific on Notice as U.S. Priorities Shift
desc: China is flexing its military muscle in the region to show that it will not wait for the Trump administration to decide how hard it wants to counter Beijing.
author: By Chris Buckley and Damien Cave

header: In Greenland, Taking It All In With Snowy Jogs and Sled Dogs
desc: On a nearly two-week reporting trip to the island, one Times reporter made time for exercise and ice fishing.
author: By Jeffrey Gettleman

header: Shocked by Trump, Zelensky and Ukraine Try to Forge a Path Forward
desc: After President Trump’s rebukes, President Volodymyr Zelensky tried to repair the relationship with his counterpart while also reaching out to European allies.
author: By Marc Santora and Andrew E. Kramer

header: Europe Races to Repair a Split Between the U.S. and Ukraine
desc: European leaders pledge to assemble a “coalition of the willing” to develop a plan for ending Ukraine’s war with Russia, which they hope could win the backing of a skeptical President Trump.
author: By Mark Landler and Stephen Castle

header: Europe Is Left With Hard Choices as Trump Sours on Ukraine
desc: European leaders have been working to support Ukraine and beef up their own defenses. But the blowup between President Trump and Ukraine’s president on Friday made those goals more urgent.
author: By Jeanna Smialek

header: Trump’s Dressing Down of Zelensky Plays Into Putin’s War Aims
desc: The public blowup could propel President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia to escalate the fight in Ukraine instead of agreeing to peace.
author: By Anton Troianovski, Nataliya Vasilyeva and Paul Sonne

header: Finland Lets Ship Leave, Two Months After Suspected Sabotage
desc: The Finnish authorities suggested that the ship, which was seized on suspicion of involvement in the cutting of undersea cables, had ties to Russia.
author: By Amelia Nierenberg and Johanna Lemola

header: Canada-U.S. Relations Continue to Reach Lows Over Tariffs and Annexation Threats
desc: President Trump said he would impose potentially devastating tariffs on Tuesday, inspiring patriotism in Canada.
author: By Ian Austen

header: Welcome to the Zero Sum Era. Now How Do We Get Out?
desc: Zero-sum thinking has spread like a mind virus, from geopolitics to pop culture.
author: By Damien Cave

header: Who Will Join Europe’s ‘Coalition of the Willing’ to Help Ukraine?
desc: European leaders met in London to form a plan to help end the war in Ukraine. But even potential peacekeepers face political and economic hurdles.
author: By Mark Landler and Jeanna Smialek

header: Zelensky Offers Terms to Stop Fighting, Assuring U.S. That Ukraine Wants Peace
desc: “We are working on all possible scenarios to protect Ukraine,” said President Volodymyr Zelensky, whose country was looking to European allies for support.
author: By Marc Santora

header: Why Is Trump Pausing Aid to Ukraine? What to Know.
desc: The decision marked the realization of a fear that has racked Ukraine since President Trump’s re-election.
author: By Lara Jakes and Cassandra Vinograd

header: A Thousand Snipers in the Sky: The New War in Ukraine
desc: Drones have changed the war in Ukraine, with soldiers adapting off-the-shelf models and swarming the front lines.
author: By Marc Santora, Lara Jakes, Andrew E. Kramer, Marco Hernandez and Liubov Sholudko

header: The Wi-Fi Code Is ‘TrumpLovesYou,’ but the Cafe’s Clients Aren’t Feeling It
desc: At a pizza and coffee joint in Kyiv named for the U.S. president, patrons are having second thoughts about its moniker after President Trump suspended military aid to Ukraine.
author: By Kim Barker

header: Zelensky Turns to Diplomacy in a War With ‘a Long Way to Go’
desc: After a startling clash with President Trump, who has echoed the Kremlin view of the war, Ukraine’s leader is trying to shore up European support and smooth over relations with Washington.
author: By Marc Santora

header: Ukrainians Worried After Trump Suspends Military Aid
desc: Across Ukraine, people were shocked and upset about the potential effects of the United States’ decision.
author: By The Associated Press and Reuters

header: Europe Tries to Boost Military Spending as America Realigns
desc: The European Commission’s president unveiled a sweeping plan to help Ukraine and boost defense spending, but it won’t be easy.
author: By Jeanna Smialek and Steven Erlanger

header: A Russia-Friendly Region Cheers Trump’s Reordering of the U.S. Role in the World
desc: Many ethnic Serbs in what was once Yugoslavia have long chafed at Washington’s foreign policy. ‘Trump’s America is different,’ said a former leader of a Serb enclave in Bosnia.
author: By Andrew Higgins

header: Germans Agree to Borrow More for Military, in Sharp Response to Trump
desc: The agreement between Friedrich Merz, the likely next chancellor, and his potential coalition partners also includes big new infrastructure spending.
author: By Jim Tankersley

header: When Every Funeral Is the Most Important
desc: As Ukrainian casualties spiral after years of war, a military band has the melancholy but key task of bidding farewell to troops and raising morale.
author: By Maria Varenikova and Mauricio Lima

header: How Soon Could Ukraine’s Forces ‘Start to Buckle’ Without U.S. Weapons?
desc: It could be as little as four months, say analysts, as Europe scrambles to plug the hole in support left by President Trump’s suspension of military aid.
author: By Lara Jakes and Josh Holder

header: Europe Races to Craft a Trump-Era Plan for Ukraine and Defense
desc: European leaders are gathering in Brussels to discuss how to support Ukraine and fend more for themselves on defense.
author: By Jeanna Smialek

header: Missile Strikes Hotel in Zelensky’s Hometown in Ukraine
desc: At least four people were killed in a Russian attack, Ukraine said, amid concerns about air defenses after the U.S. said it was suspending military and intelligence aid.
author: By Marc Santora

header: America the Evil Mastermind? Not So Fast, Russians Are Told.
desc: As President Trump begins to side with Russia, the Kremlin propaganda machine has changed its tune.
author: By Anton Troianovski

header: King Charles III, a Quiet Diplomat, is Stepping Up
desc: As he welcomed the leaders of Ukraine and Canada to his country estate this week, the king was sending a message to the world.
author: By Mark Landler

header: After Days of Coaching, Zelensky Seeks a Path to Trump’s Good Graces
desc: Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain and President Emmanuel Macron of France have been prodding and counseling Volodymyr Zelensky on how to deal with President Trump.
author: By Marc Santora and Mark Landler

header: New Zealand Dismisses Top Diplomat in U.K. After His Remarks on Trump
desc: The envoy, Phil Goff, questioned President Trump’s understanding of history at a public event about the war in Ukraine.
author: By Victoria Kim

header: Russian Missile Strikes Hotel in Zelensky’s Hometown
desc: Residents and aid workers said they received warnings only a few minutes before a missile struck a hotel in the hometown of President Volodymyr Zelensky in central Ukraine.
author: By Reuters, The Associated Press and Storyful

header: As Alliances Fray Under Trump, This Nation Is Confident of U.S. Ties
desc: Officials in the Philippines say that President Trump will not pull back from defense commitments because Manila and Washington have a common adversary.
author: By Sui-Lee Wee

header: Russian Strikes Kill 20 in Eastern Ukraine as U.S. Reduces Its Support
desc: The bombardment came after Washington’s decision to suspend intelligence sharing and hit a region critical for Ukrainian logistics and support.
author: By Kim Barker

header: U.S. Suspends Ukraine’s Access to Satellite Imagery
desc: Ukraine uses the technology to track the movement of Russian troops and assess damage to infrastructure.
author: By Eve Sampson

header: With Drones and North Korean Troops, Russia Pushes Back Ukraine’s Offensive
desc: Russia has retaken about two-thirds of the territory Ukraine seized last summer in the Kursk region of Russia, but at a fearful cost in lives.
author: By Marc Santora

header: Russia Hits Ukrainian Power and Gas Facilities in Widespread Attack
desc: The bombardment came just days after the United States said it was suspending intelligence sharing with Ukraine.
author: By Marc Santora

header: Alarmed by Trump, Poland Must Look at Nuclear Options, Premier Says
desc: As President Trump casts doubt on U.S. alliances, Poland needs to double its military manpower and consider more destructive weapons, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said.
author: By Andrew Higgins

header: North Korea Says It’s Building a Nuclear-Powered Submarine
desc: The announcement came amid fears that Pyongyang may be receiving crucial military technology from Russia in return for sending troops and weapons for its war against Ukraine.
author: By Choe Sang-Hun

header: Kharkiv Bombarded By Russian Strikes Overnight
desc: The strikes were aimed at critical Ukrainian infrastructure and increased worries that the Trump administration’s decision to withhold intelligence assistance could leave Ukraine more vulnerable.
author: By McKinnon de Kuyper

header: Europe’s Security Dilemma Explained
desc: European leaders met in Brussels on Thursday to discuss how to fill the gap in military support for Ukraine created by President Trump’s suspension of aid and intelligence.
author: By Jeanna Smialek, Nikolay Nikolov and James Surdam

header: A Europe in Emotional Shock Grapples With a New Era
desc: It remains to be seen how far President Trump’s embrace of Russia and abandonment of traditional allies will go. But “the West” may be gone.
author: By Roger Cohen

header: 3 Bulgarians Found Guilty of Spying for Russia in Britain and Europe
desc: The group of Bulgarians, who were living in the U.K., were convicted by a London jury of conducting surveillance operations across Europe on behalf of the Russian state.
author: By Stephen Castle

header: Russian Forces Depleted and Stalling on Eastern Front, Ukraine Says
desc: The front line inside Ukraine has become more static, Ukrainian soldiers say, even as Russia regains ground in its own Kursk region.
author: By Marc Santora

header: Trump’s Attacks Give Zelensky a Bit of a Reprieve at Home
desc: The Ukrainian leader’s approval rating is rising, and critics have backed off after he was humiliated and criticized by President Trump, who has also demanded new elections in Ukraine.
author: By Kim Barker

header: How Would Peacekeeping Work in Ukraine? These Experts Gamed It Out.
desc: The publication of the detailed analysis was a sign that a cease-fire has gone from a theoretical exercise to an urgent and practical issue.
author: By Anton Troianovski

header: Romania Bars Ultranationalist Candidate From Presidential Race
desc: The country’s electoral commission ruled on Sunday that Calin Georgescu, an outspoken critic of Ukraine and NATO, could not compete in the do-over election.
author: By Andrew Higgins

header: Ukraine Supports 30-Day Cease-Fire as U.S. Says It Will Resume Military Aid
desc: The deal announced on Tuesday delivered new momentum to efforts to halt the fighting, with the ball for any truce now in Russia’s court, said Secretary of State Marco Rubio.
author: By Andrew E. Kramer and Alan Rappeport

header: Putin, Dressed in Fatigues, Visits Kursk to Cheer Efforts to Oust Ukraine’s Troops
desc: The trip comes as President Trump looks to secure the Russian leader’s support for a 30-day cease-fire.
author: By Paul Sonne

header: Russia Begins Assault on Ukrainian-Occupied Town in Kursk Region
desc: Moscow’s military advances on the town of Sudzha may deprive Kyiv of a bargaining chip in peace talks.
author: By Anatoly Kurmanaev

header: U.S. and Ukraine Discuss a 30-Day Cease-Fire: What to Know
desc: Kyiv said it would support the Trump administration’s proposal for a cease-fire with Russia. The Kremlin has not said whether it will do the same.
author: By Andrew E. Kramer, Ivan Nechepurenko and Marc Santora

header: Ukraine Targets Moscow With Large-Scale Drone Attack
desc: The assault, which the mayor called the largest on Russia’s capital since the war began, was a reminder of Ukraine’s power to strike as its president proposes an air truce.
author: By Marc Santora and Ivan Nechepurenko

header: Zelensky Says Ukraine Showed ‘We Want a Fast Peace’
desc: While Ukraine said it would agree to a 30-day cease-fire proposal, many in the country were skeptical about whether Russia would do the same.
author: By Marc Santora and Maria Varenikova

header: U.S.-Backed Cease-Fire Offer Poses Dilemma for Putin
desc: Russia’s leader recently rejected the idea of an interim truce in Ukraine. But he wants to maintain his relationship with President Trump.
author: By Anton Troianovski and Nataliya Vasilyeva

header: Europe’s Armies Review a Peacekeeping Role in Ukraine
desc: The deeper discussion of a European force comes amid rising anger and dismay over President Trump’s embrace of Russia and abandonment of traditional allies.
author: By Roger Cohen

header: Europe Welcomes a Ukraine Cease-Fire Offer and a Revival of U.S. Aid
desc: Leaders worked hard to get President Volodymyr Zelensky back in the good graces of President Trump, no matter how humiliating, and to shift the onus to Russia.
author: By Steven Erlanger

header: Ukraine Launches Drone Attack Against Moscow Region
desc: The pre-dawn attack came hours before scheduled talks between high-level delegations from Ukraine and the United States in Saudi Arabia.
author: By Nader Ibrahim and Sanjana Varghese

header: Putin Demands Ukrainian Troops in Kursk Region of Russia Surrender
desc: Talks in Moscow with a U.S. special envoy indicated that Russia was keen to keep negotiating with the United States over Ukraine.
author: By Anton Troianovski and Maria Varenikova

header: Putin, in No Hurry for Cease-Fire, Seeks Ukrainian Concessions
desc: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia laid out a series of conditions that Ukraine might reject, but displayed a willingness to continue talks with President Trump.
author: By Anton Troianovski

header: Russia Claims to Have Regained Control of Key Kursk Town
desc: Ukrainian officials have not confirmed a retreat from the town in Russia’s Kursk region, parts of which were captured by Kyiv’s forces last summer.
author: By Maria Varenikova

header: In No Hurry for Cease-Fire, Putin Demands Numerous Ukrainian Concessions
desc: The remarks by the Russian leader suggested he wanted to draw out negotiations or make a truce impossible. Ukraine’s leader called the response to a cease-fire plan “manipulative.”
author: By Anton Troianovski

header: What to Know About Kursk, the Russian Territory Slipping From Ukraine’s Fingers
desc: At the height of their offensive, Ukrainian forces controlled some 500 square miles of Russian soil. Now they hold just a narrow strip of land along the border.
author: By Matthew Mpoke Bigg

header: Russian Mercenary Found Guilty of War Crimes in Ukraine by Finland Court
desc: Voislav Torden, a commander in a Russian paramilitary group, was sentenced to life in prison for the attack and mutilation of Ukrainian soldiers in 2014.
author: By Johanna Lemola and Lynsey Chutel

header: G7 Foreign Ministers Keep Tensions in Check to Agree on Ukraine Policy
desc: Secretary of State Marco Rubio found himself among allies in a fraught moment after President Trump’s tariff policies.
author: By Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Michael Crowley

header: U.S. Negotiators Are en Route to Moscow, Kremlin Says
desc: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia is weighing a 30-day cease-fire proposal from the United States and Ukraine.
author: By Anton Troianovski

header: Israel-Hamas Talks Deadlocked as Trump Envoy Turns to Ukraine
desc: The two sides are supposed to negotiate a second phase of the cease-fire agreement that would end the war, but they remain far apart on how to move forward.
author: By Aaron Boxerman

header: Here are the latest developments.
desc: NA
author: By Anton Troianovski

header: Slowly, Ukrainian Women Are Beginning to Talk About Sexual Assault in the War
desc: Thousands of women may have been raped by Russian soldiers, experts say, but have kept quiet for fear of the stigma. But that is changing.
author: By Carlotta Gall and Oleksandr Chubko

header: How Ukraine’s Offensive in Russia’s Kursk Region Unraveled
desc: At the height of the campaign, Ukrainian forces controlled some 500 square miles of Russian territory. Now they hold just a small sliver of land along the border.
author: By Marc Santora

header: Ukraine Retreats From All but a Sliver of Land in Russia’s Kursk Region
desc: The bold campaign Ukraine launched last summer to seize and occupy Russian territory appears to be nearing an end.
author: By Constant Méheut, Marc Santora and Yurii Shyvala

header: Zelensky Accuses Russia of Trying to Trap Ukraine’s Forces Amid Cease-Fire Talks
desc: The Kremlin is pressing an offensive to take back its land in the Kursk region, while prolonging negotiations over a proposal by Washington and Kyiv.
author: By Paul Sonne and Maria Varenikova

header: ‘On the Tightrope’: Britain Tries to Bridge a Widening Trans-Atlantic Gap
desc: Five years after Brexit, Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s intense diplomacy on Ukraine has put Britain back in a familiar role on the global stage.
author: By Mark Landler and Stephen Castle

header: As Trump Stirs Doubt, Europeans Debate Their Own Nuclear Deterrent
desc: Talk of replacing the American nuclear umbrella over Europe with the small British and French nuclear armories is in the air, however vague and fanciful.
author: By Steven Erlanger

header: Protest Against Serbian Leader Draws Over 100,000 in Biggest Crowd Yet
desc: The rally on Saturday in the capital, Belgrade, came as protests have spread to towns around the country and have drawn increasingly insistent calls that President Aleksandar Vucic step aside.
author: By Andrew Higgins

header: A Hectic Week in Canadian Politics and Trade, With More Action on the Way
desc: As Justin Trudeau’s nearly decade-long tenure as prime minister came to an end, new trade threats and tariffs came from Washington.
author: By Ian Austen

header: Trump and Putin Discuss Ukraine: What to Know
desc: The Kremlin said that President Vladimir V. Putin had agreed in a call with President Trump to temporarily stop strikes on Ukrainian energy infrastructure.
author: By Constant Méheut and Ivan Nechepurenko

header: Why Has a Ukrainian Nuclear Plant Become Part of Cease-Fire Talks?
desc: The U.S. is seeking access to Ukrainian minerals, which require extensive energy to process. The Zaporizhzhia power plant in southern Ukraine, which Russia controls, could help with that, Kyiv says.
author: By Constant Méheut

header: Braving Artillery Strikes to Serve Fresh Sushi in a Frontline Town
desc: Sushi has long been a popular indulgence in Ukraine. For the residents of Sloviansk, a city in Russian cross hairs, it can provide a sense of normalcy that is akin to a necessity in wartime.
author: By Cassandra Vinograd, Dzvinka Pinchuk and Brendan Hoffman

header: Trump’s Plan to Discuss Ukraine’s Power Plants With Putin Prompts Questions
desc: The call, scheduled for Tuesday, will be the first known conversation between the two leaders since Mr. Putin laid out numerous conditions for a cease-fire with Ukraine.
author: By Ivan Nechepurenko and Constant Méheut

header: De Gaulle Rises as France Sours on Trump’s America
desc: Charles de Gaulle’s insistence on French power and autonomy is being cited widely in France; one politician demanded that an America on “the side of the tyrants” return the Statue of Liberty.
author: By Roger Cohen

header: Germany Is Lifting a Foot Off Its ‘Debt Brake.’ Here’s Why.
desc: An incoming government wants to borrow much more to revamp the economy and rebuild the military. That means a change in the country’s Constitution — and its culture.
author: By Jim Tankersley and Christopher F. Schuetze
